subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Snowden Revelations: Surveillance Exposed
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Snowden Revelations: Surveillance Exposed.

hook.text: In 2013, an NSA contractor revealed that the U.S. government was secretly surveilling billions of people.

buildup.text: Edward Snowden leaked classified documents showing programs like PRISM that collected data from tech giants.

discovery.text: The NSA was tapping undersea cables, hacking foreign leaders' phones, and collecting metadata on every call.

twist.text: Tech companies claimed ignorance but were legally compelled to cooperate. Trust in the entire industry shattered.

climax.text: The leaks triggered global encryption adoption and reforms to surveillance law worldwide.

punchline.text: One whistleblower changed how the world thinks about privacy.

quiz.question: What NSA program collected data from major tech companies?
